Ah, the seductive, sultry, super-spy Natalia Romanova?

How does it happen?
11511.title: Black Widow

choices: She agrees with question. It's for the greater good.
She has no answer. It's asking a lot out of her.
115111.content:
I own nothing. Everything belongs to Marvel. They are awesome.

Fire. Smoke. Screams. Blood. Violence. Death.

The bad dreams came rushing back to her while she slept, like a strong river current.
The bad dreams of that day. The day of fire, smoke, screams, blood, violence, and death.

Some people of the world called it "Herofall" while other called it "Age's End" but it all meant the same thing:

The day when heroes and villains, the forces of light and the forces of darkness, clashed one last time, leaving a trail of death and destruction behind them, and a new world to be rebuilt from the ashes of the old one.

It wasn't supposed to be that way. There was an odd truce between the heroes and the villains. The villains would attack and the heroes would defend. The good guys would win and the bad guys would live to fight another day. Yet, as time went by, the heroes, those sworn to protect, ended fighting each other, instead of those who were sworn to destroy and rule. Civil wars, the clash of two teams, it seemed like the heroes were imploding, turning their violence onto each other, unaware they were making themselves weaker, while others grew stronger.

And when HE arrived, it was the end. Neurothought was what he was called, at least by those who fought him. His real name was impossible to be pronounced by a human tongue, super, mutant, mystical, or otherwise. He came from a time beyond time, from a dying world, from the deepest darkest regions of the universe.

He was a ruler, a tyrant. His word was law, his power absolute, her strength unmatched. His people in stasis, he arrived on Earth with one simple goal: Take what his people needed, by any means necessary. But he arrived not with lasers, or armies, he arrived with a parasite, that when introduced into a human body, give him almost complete control.

With this parasite he enslaved nearly all of the world's mightiest heroes and villains, for one purpose: To destroy themselves, to destroy each other, to guarantee his absolute victory.

He studied the failure of all those who came to this planet before him, those who ultimately failed in their conquest by the might of the heroes. He would not make the same mistake. He would use the beloved heroes to his advantage, to annihilate, and when all was ashes, his people would repopulate and rebuild. They would have a second chance. HE would have a second chance, to fix the mistakes he made, which cost his people their old world, and nearly doomed them.

She dreamt of that day. She dreamt of fire. She dreamt of smoke. She dream of screams, blood, violence and death. Seeing Tony Stark, fall from the heavens trailing red, seeing Steve laying broken, and still on the road, Thor standing over him, blood dripping from his hammer. She saw Clint, fall and die, a pair of adamantium claws piercing his heart.

Neurothought's brain parasites didn't infect everyone, that would have been too easy. No, Neurothought wanted to watch those not-infected race to save those were, waste their resources, and their time, while the infected heroes and villains destroyed each other and everything in their path.

It worked better than he had hoped. By the end, estimates put the casualties on both sides at nearly 90%. It did not matter to him that they found a cure for his parasites, nor that the non-infected heroes and villains joined forces to stop him. No. It did not matter to him by the end, because he would be dead, and those left uninfected would be his judge, his jury, and his executioner.

The days following were dark ones. Many funerals, untold lives caught in the crossfire, entire cities leveled. When it was all over, those who remained, put aside their ideas of costume heroics and villainy, and instead, vanished into the shadows. What use would they be anymore? The world had seen enough. They had seen enough.

She never considered retiring. This was her life. This was the only life she ever knew. She had nothing else. SHIELD remained, more as a figurehead than
anything else, the world governments deciding to create their own unified task force, one not needing to be supported by costume characters.
Her days were lonely, her night even lonelier. She dreamt of days gone by, of old friends dead and buried, of the once bright future ahead of them all.

Now all she dream of was fire; and smoke, fire, and screams and blood and violence. She dreamt of death.

Natalia "Black Widow" Romanova was awakened by the buzz of her communicator, it's single light illuminating every dark corner of her room on board the Helicarrier.

Years of training kicked in, and she was alert and ready for action, milliseconds later.
"What is it General Fury?" Natalia asked, ready for a briefing.

On the other end of her communicator screen, a bald, eye-patched older african american man, looked at her, hesitating to ask her something.
"Do your ever think about them Agent Romanova?" He asks, his face blank as slate.
"General.." She was hesitant to respond. Why was he asking this?
"Do you ever think about that day? What we lost? What the world lost? Why did we survive when some many others didn't?" Fury asked her again, his voice monotone.
Has he been drinking? She thought. She couldn't blame him. Many of those who survived took up drinking after they took off their costumes.
"Do you know what we fought for? We fought for a legacy. They died for a legacy. And what if I told you that legacy could continue?" Nice Fury said.
"What are you talking about?" Natalia asked him.
"I'm talking about giving back some hope into the world. Those people out there, in the normal world, think they've seen the worst of what's out in the universe. We both now that isn't true. They're will always be another Thanos, another Galactus, another Nuerothought - - And they're coming. Maybe not today, and maybe not tomorrow. But somewhere down the line, they will come, and the world will not be ready. It needs hope. It need hope that there will be people still around to rise up and fight that new darkness off.

They need a legacy to hold onto; and a legacy is what I intend to give them. I've asked a lot from you Natalia, but what I ask of you might be more than I ever thought possible. I'm asking you to give up everything you know, everything you might ever know, to preserve a legacy, to preserve the chance that a hundred, maybe even a thousand years from now, we will be ready". Nick Fury said, his voice never changing, his face deadly serious,

"Nick, do you have any idea what time it is? Couldn't this wait until morning?" She asked.
"Time is off the uptmost importance. Banner has just made the breakthrough we needed and this might be only chance. CHIMERA, has been sniffing around SHIELD files. This new world police usually only worries about it's own business, but word has been leaking out that we're up to something." Nick Fury said.

CHIMERA, the global international police force that now rivaled SHIELD after the events of that dark day. Their only mission was to protect humanity at any cost, including putting down whatever remained of the superheroes, should it ever come to that.
"And why would CHIMERA think we were up to something sir?" Natalia asked, already knowing the answer.

"Because we are. What we're doing is in violation of international Suspension Of Super Powered Activities, which would make us International Enemy #1 But if we're successful, it will mean a brighter future for humanity when organizations like CHIMERA ultimately fail. But I need your help on this, you're the only person I obsoletely trust with this" Fury stated looking at her with his one good eye.

"What is it?" She asked.
"Basically stated, Banner's been working on a serum, and just made the breakthrough an hour ago, and we need a female test-subject. Combining the absolute perfect genetic strands from the DNA profiles of current living and deceased superhero, once this serum reacts to you, it's going to create a rapidly gestating life form, based on the DNA in the serum and the genetic material of the female host." Nick Fury said.

She couldn't believe what Fury was asking her to do. She didn't want to believe what Fury was asking her to do.
"You mean to tell that you - - - -" Natalia said.
"Yes Natalia, we want you to get pregnant with a new generation of superheroes." Fury said, his face showing no emotion.
115111.title: A New Hope For A Dark Tomorrow.

choices: She heads off to the medical bay - Motherhood waits for no super spy!
She needs someone to talk to - Whose up right now?
1151111.content:
Pregnant?! Me?! Is he crazy? Natalia thought to herself, staring at Nick Fury, his face an empty book, unable to be read.
"I know it's alot to ask Natalia" Nick Fury states.
"That's literarily an understatement. Do you have any idea what your asking me to do? What your asking me to sacrifice?" Natalia asked.
"No more than anyone else. Steve gave his life fighting for what he believe in, so did Clint. They sacrificed their bodies to preserve a legacy, and now we're asking you to make the same, in a manner of speaking." Nick Fury states.

"But sir? Pregnancy? Motherhood? Not exactly within my field of expertise" she said.
"We're all outside our comfort zone on this one Natalia. But this something that needs to be done. If you worried about your obligations, SHIELD is prepared to handle everything. We have a large monetary fund set up for you to handle everything you possibly need. Clothing, food, education. We will have nannies on call 24/7 should you wish to be hands-off, although I highly advise against that. I want these children to have a happy healthy upbringing. Christmases, birthday parties, after school sports - - It's all based of an extensive psyche report put together by our top shrinks: A good upbringing will make good heroes with a sense of right-and-wrong. I believe the late Peter Parker once said "With great power, comes great responsibility". Nick Fury stated.

Christmases? Birthday parities? Play dates? Natalia thought to herself, entertaining his offer. Children were never on the horizon for me, even before those bastards rendered me infertile. She thinks back, to those days in the "Black Widow" program. The things they subjected her too, the Red Room's variant of the Super-Soldier Serum and Biotechnology, that made her the woman she is today. Stronger, faster, smarter, healthier, than any other normal human.

And now, Dr. Bruce Banner, one of, if not, the world's smartest man, was given her a chance for the one-thing she thought she could never be: A mother. Someone somebody would look up to, be infallible, someone who would love her for just being her, not some convoluted plot of clones, double agents and brainwashing. She was offered a true piece of herself that no-one could take away.

"Fury, I" she paused, thinking this over. They CHOSE her. They didn't ask anyone else, as far as she knew, Fury chose her to be their Eve. A beacon of light for the future generations of the world that the guardians would not leave them, that no force on Earth or beyond the stars could take away their brightly colored champions.

"Yes Natalia?" Fury asks.

"If I agree to this - - -" she said, hesitantly.
This was it. This was her last chance. If she agreed to this, her life would never be the same. Gone would be the days of action, spying, and saving the world. It would be replaced with parent-teacher meetings, diaper changes, and motherhood. If she declined, which she could very well do, she could go on living her life as it was. One of the last of her kind, fighting and protecting, until the day she died alone, probably in some hellhole somewhere in the universe, trying to stop another threat from killing everything.

"Yes?"
This is it Natalia. Make you choice She thought. Belly, babies, child-rearing, life. Bullets, bombs, world-saving, death.
"Agent Romanova. Time is off the essence. I need an answer" Nick Fury ordered.

She closed her eyes.

This was it.

Peter Parker's dying words echoed in her head. Tell them, tell whoever comes after us - With Great Power, Comes Great Responsibility Well, they weren't officially his last words, they were the last words officially issued to the public at his funeral, turning him from outcast to hero. They even built a statue for him in lobby of The Daily Bugle, and his birthday was going be to an unofficial holiday. Most of her dead's friends birthday's were going to be holidays. Officially, all of the superheroes who died were going to be remember on Hero's Day, an official federal holiday, with television specials, fireworks, parades, days off from school; it was the least the world could do for them; everyone said.

"I - - -" she paused.

She closed her eyes.

"I want them to have a nice house. In a nice neighborhood. With good schools, no great schools. A nice little suburb somewhere, and a white picket fence." She thought, her decision made.

She was going to be a mom.

"Are you sure about this?" Nick Fury asked.

"No. But this is something the world needs. They need a new generation to latch onto. If you take away people's hope for a better tomorrow, when the next bad guy shows up, they will bend their knee instead of raising their fist." Natalia says

"Very well. Report to the medical bay in one hour. Banner will be ready for you. In the meantime, I'll have our shield agents find you your perfect house, and begin purchasing the necessary supplies. You're going to need cribs, baby clothes, food, toys, books - -" Nick Fury said with a pause
"And probably some bigger items for yourself" He said finishing his thought

Oh, I didn't think about my figure she thought, catching sight of herself in the full-length mirror in her room. Well, we all make sacrifices

"There will be time for all that later General Fury, its - - - " Natalia said.
"Natalia, there is something you should now. This Serum, causes an accelerated pregnancy. You won't have nine months. You'll have nine days, maybe ten." Fury stare was blank and emotionless.

"Nine days? You mean?" Natalia asks.
"Yes, that's a month a day. But don't worry. The rapid growth is only in-uetero, once their born, they will grow just like an other happy healthy child." Nick Fury states.
"Were you going to keep this from me?" Natalia asks, the thought of motherhood in two weeks starts sending off alarm bells in her head.
"No. We would have told you before we injected you with the serum. When I say time is off the utmost importance, we mean it. We don't have time to make new superheroes the old fashioned way. We need them, and we need them now. Our analysts predict another ELE level event like Herofall within a 15-to-16 year period at the earliest." Nick Fury states, the gravity of the situation becoming clearer.

She thought about Fury's word, hoping for an excuse to back out, but finding none. The world needed this, SHIELD needed this.

I need this She thought.

"Well then, you better get searching. I hear it's a buyer's market right now. Don't disappoint" She said.
"It will be the best house Stark's money can by." Fury said.
"Stark? I didn't know he had a fund for SHIELD". Natalia asks.
"He doesn't. But, what's a few missing millions for him?" Fury says with a smile on his face.
"How's he doing?" Natalia asks.
She hasn't been to see Stark in weeks. She just couldn't bring herself to see him like that.
"Pepper says that's he showing some very prominent brain activity. They think he might walk up from the coma soon.
But enough about him. Medical Bay - One Hour" Fury said.

CLICK! Nick Fury's face disappears, leaving the communicator screen blank.

No turning back now.

She made her choice, and she was going to have to live with it.

For the next 18 years.

She placed her hand on her flat stomach.

"Oh boy" she said to herself.

Or girl she thought.
1151111.title: For The Greater Good

choices: She passes out, waking up several hours later in the medical bay.
She feels hungry, she's eating for two now after all.
11511111.content:
She had made her decision.
They're was no turning back now.
At least, not in a way she could see.
But then again, she wasn't looking for a way out.

Most specifically, she was looking for a way in; the doors to the medical bay sealed shut, the lights off, nobody home.
She was annoyed. She was woken up at 1:30 in the morning, agreed to be impregnated for a medical experiment, and then when the time came for the process to begin, Dr. Banner was nowhere to be seen.

She was eager.
Eager to do her part, to ensure the future of humanity. What General Fury said was true, somewhere, sometime down the road, another bad guy was going to arrive, and there would be no one to lead the charge. She was eager to prevent that. She was eager for - -

Motherhood? She thought to herself. Was she really agreeing to this out of some misguided blind devotion to the greater good, or was it simply something far more selfish? The thought that whatever Banner and Fury had whipped up in there was her first, best, and only hope of having a child, some small part of her running around that said "I was here. I existed, and to this person, I mattered."

She pounded on the door, one more time, as hard as she could, nearly denting a small section of the frame, when the lights came on in the medical bay, and a lone, meek, one-armed figure came shuffling out in a dirty t-shirt and sweatpants, wearing a lab coat and his glasses.

Dr. Bruce Banner, one of the smartest men in the history of the world, and, after the events of "Herofall" he might have been the smartest man alive on the planet. He stifled a yawn with his one good (and only) arm, adjusting his glasses, and looked at her.

"Ah, good morning Agent Romanova. I see you've been convinced to join us for a little project" he said.
"Not so little from what I've heard, although I'll probably find that out first hand - - - IF it works" Natalia said.
Natalia Romanova was not a fan of Bruce Banner. He was smarter than everyone else and he knew it. He was cleverer than everyone else and he knew it.

He was more dangerous than everyone else, AND HE KNEW IT.

Dr. Bruce Banner is what happens when science and a lack of a human conscious run amok. Although, you wouldn't guess it by looking at him.

"It will work, Agent Romanova. All of my work is successful, you knew that." Banner says, stepping aside, showing her into the medical bay, a surgical table standing in the center, a large needle and a bottle of a glowing green liquid right next to it.

"Except for the work you're doing to cure your little problem" She says coldly, walking towards the table.
"Ah, yes. Quite clever Agent Romanova, now if you would please lift up your shirt and lie on the table we can begin." He says, reaching for his missing arm to scratch it, but finding nothing but air.

"Does it still bother you Bruce?" Natalia inquires, in a rare moment of civility between the two.
"I swear everyday it gets worse. It's like I can still feel it there. I talked to Kurt about it, and he says it's going to get worse before it gets better." He says, prepping everything for the injection.
"You talked to Kurt Conners?" Natalia asks, knowing that Kurt Conners, also known as The Lizard, was one of the few survivors of Herofall, and also a sworn enemy to Peter Parker, AKA The Amazing Spider-Man, a fallen friend and former Avenger.
"I know he's not the best company but there's not many members in the "brilliant one-armed scientists with a control problem that causes them to turn into a giant monsters" support group; I have to take what I can get. Besides, without his help, we would not have been able to finish this serum.
Now lay down and lift up your shirt." Banner said without emotion.

He was switching into scientist mode, and when he was focused in his work, he was unemotional. He didn't risk his darker half coming out.
At the crux of Herofall, when the mightest of Earth's heroes and villains clashed to the death, Bruce Banner, or, The Hulk more specifically, was hesitant to join the fighting, despite direct orders from The Avengers.

He was afraid. Afraid of what might happen if Nuerothought got control of him, a giant green rage made with unlimited strength and power.
If it wasn't the end, it would be damn near close. The Hulk only joined the battle when his love, Betty Ross when being held captive by a mind-controlled Thor, coaxing him out.

When the Hulk arrived, hell followed behind him. Thor and The Hulk were supposedly the most powerful beings in the known universe, and when the two fought, the world shook in fear. The battle lasted for hours, Thor, pushed beyond his physical limit, nearly brought down the Hulk permanently, severing the green giants arm from his body with a series of devastating blows from his hammer.

Many thought the Hulk's regenerative abilities were limitless. That day proved many wrong.
It was only hours later, and the sacrifice of Captain America against Thor, was Thor finally able to break the spell of the brain parasite with the help of Mr. Fantastic.
Thor, after seeing what he did to his friends, left the mortal world after the battle, and has never returned sense.

Black Widow laid down on the table, and lifted up her shirt, her perfect abs visible against her smooth skin.
"Is this going to hurt?" Black Widow asked, almost out a force of habit.
"Yes." Dr. Banner said, readying the needle.
"Great bedside manner" she retorted, preparing herself for what came next.
"I'm going to give you the cliff notes Natalia, because time is short. CHIMERA has found out we're working on this, and is probably going to be stopping by to shut us down. They'll take everything. The notes, the prototypes, the backups, the backups of the backups. We'll lose everything. Everything that was fought and sacrificed will be meaningless. This serum is going to change that. It's going to make sure people like us will still be around and still matter.

It's going to rewrite parts of your genetic material, namely the sections of the Super-Soldier Serum knock-off you were given by Red Room in her early days in the Black Widow program. It's going to undo the damage that serum did, and allow you to have a child, while still preserving your abilities. It's going to hurt a lot, but it will work." Banner says, preparing to inject her.

"How will I know when it works?" She asks, knowing it's a stupid question.
"Oh you'll know. Believe me you'll know" And without warning, Banner pierces her skin with the needle, pushing down the plunger.
Natalia Romanova could feel it coursing through her, spreading a warm tingle through every section of her body. It felt good, like being wrapped up in a warm blanket on a cold winter's day.

"And done." Banner said, emptying the last of the serum into her, putting the needle on the table next to him.
"That wasn't so bad" she says, enjoying the warmness flowing through her.
"Oh, that's not the bad part. That bad part will becoming in thirty seconds if my calculations are correct." He says, looking at his watch.

The gentle warmness turned into a raging inferno running through her. Every inch of her body felt like it was melting, her body suddenly becoming heavy with sweat. She trashed and convulsed as the pain ravaged through her.

She's been in some pain before, she was a spy, it came with the territory, but this was unlike anything she ever felt before.
She felt as if she was dying.

"It's almost over! It's almost over! Just power through it, and it will be all over!" He shouted over her groans and moans.
Suddenly, just as it started, the burning turned back into a mild warmth, that seemed to dissipate all over her body, before settling in her belly.
That too, lasted a few mere moments before vanishing completely.

She was tired, and sweaty. She weakly turned her head towards Banner.
"Did it work?" She asked.

He looked at his watch, waiting for something to occur.
Time marched forwards, seconds turning into minutes.

"Well?" She asked, growing annoyed.
"You tell me. We should be finding out very soon." He said.

It hit her like a truck, a sudden feeling of needing to throw up. NOW.
She threw herself off the table, and with shaky legs, ran towards the bathroom in the medical bay as fast as she could.
She barely made it as she felt her dinner make a reappearance from her mouth to the toilet bowl.
URK! was the noise she made, hurling once again into the toilet.

A few moments passed any her stomach settled. She flushed the toilet, sending the sick to the Helicarrier's on board sewage storage tanks. She got up slowly off the floor, and left the bathroom only to be greeted by a smiling Dr. Banner.

"Congratulations Natalia. It worked" was all he said.
11511111.title: Medical Bay - Science? Hulk like science!

choices: She make it there no problem.
115111111.content:
Natalia didn't remember much of what happened next.
All she remember was the seemingly unending nausea, standing up, Banner saying something to her, and blackness, as tiredness suddenly enveloped her.

She dreamt.

Not of fire. Not of smoke. Not of screams, blood, violence, or death.

She dreamt of joy. Of life. Of hope. Of a better tomorrow.

She dreamt of a small blue two-story house, with a white door and a white picket-fence. She dreamt of a yard, littered with toys. She dreamt of children's clothing, hanging on a clothes line, gently swaying in the breeze of a warm summer's day. She dreamt of herself looking into a mirror, a medium sized firm bulge visible through her clothing.

She dreamt of a future, a far future, where humanity would stand and watch as her children fought alongside a new generation of heroes against a new threat beyond her imagining. She dreamt of a son and a daughter, lifting their fists high into the air, shouting the words "ASSEMBLE!"

When she awoke, it was several hours later in the medical bay, and she was alone. Looking around, she found a note on a digipad from Bruce Banner.
"Natalia, everything went well. I recommend taking it easy for the next few days. Bed rest and some serious calorie intake are doctor's orders! If you don't, you'll make me angry. And you won't like me when I'm angry. - Banner" It ended with a little winking emoticon.

Natalia stood up, still feeling a little shaky from a few hours earlier.

Slowly, she took in everything that has happened to her, placing her hand on her (now) flat stomach.

Oh Natalia, I think you're in a little over your head on this one she thinks.

She left the medical bay, thought she not alone.
She would never be alone.
Not anymore.

GROAN. A fierce yearning for food came from stomach.
Hungry little one? Natalia thinks to herself, the feeling of her quickly approaching motherhood washing over her.

"Well now, Uncle Banner recommended eating, and I'm starving. Perhaps we should go find something to eat?" She says to her passenger, who gives no reply.

She turns the corner of the hallway, heading towards the mess hall.
115111111.title: Black Widow Fast Pregnancy - Day 1: Baby Steps

choices: Black Widow was summoned to the Medbay by Banner.
Black Widow receives a call from Nick Fury
1151111111.content:
Her stomach was groaning loudly with hunger as she entered the mess hall.

Her years of training as spy for both Russia and America had taught her to move without sound, blending with the shadows, being a walking ghost; no one ever knowing she was there until it was too late.

It was just the same as she crept into the mess hall, the clock on the wall reading 5:35 AM. While there weren't many active members of The Avengers aboard the helicarrier, Black Widow didn't want to risk waking anyone. The last thing she wanted anyone to see was her stuffing her face, I mean, she may now be an expectant mother, but she still had an image to uphold, even if just for a few days.

She opened the fridge and began to dig through it's contents, trying to find something. Eventually she found what appeared to be several slices of pizza, with the word's "Flash's Pizza. DO NOT EAT. I WILL KNOW IF YOU DO" written on it in bright red letters.

"Sorry Flash. I need it more than you do" Natalia says with a smirk, taking a bite of the cold slice.

Eugene "Flash" Thompson or "Venom" as he was know known as, was every bit the solider that Captain America was or Natalia currently was, even after losing his legs in Iraq. Of course, Project Rebirth 2.0 fixed that when they bonded him the symbiote, restoring his ability to walk and given him nearly identical powers to Spider-Man, which shouldn't have been a surprise to anyone, it still was the Venom symbiote after all.

She took another huge bite out of her slice of pizza, feeling the gnawing hunger inside of her dissipate some.

So with the hunger issue solved, I think it's time to start coming up with more pressing matters Natalia thought to herself. So what do you think kid? Boy or Girl? Do I buy you a baseball or a doll? She thought, chewing, looking at her flat midsection, hoping for some kind of response from her passenger.

Well, I guess we can cross telepathy of the list of your potential powers she thinks, taking a huge bite out of another piece of pizza.

Not long after "Herofall" as people called it, many of the surviving different superhero teams folded into each other or vanished completely. The Thunderbolts were invited to be folded into what remained of the Avengers. Flash accepted immediately, seeing as his powers could fill the void left behind by Parker's death, and well because, he was a soldier, and it was his duty. The same was said for Thaddeus "Red Hulk" Ross, who rejoined the team after Fury benched Banner after losing his arm.

"The world doesn't need a one-armed Hulk" Fury told Banner bluntly. Natalia thought that Ross was more than a little too happy to replace Banner as the heavy hitter of the group, taking away from Banner something else he loved. Well, maybe not loved, but needed.
Those two would never get along, even after everything they've been through Natalia thought, scarfing down her third slice of pizza.

She went back to the fridge, and poured herself some orange juice, and started dunking her pizza into the glass.
Orange Juice and Pizza. I must be pregnant she thought, chewing her citrusy pizza. It was divine.

Frank Castle AKA The Punisher was one of the few non-powered humans who survived "Herofall", although no-one has any idea how. He spat in Fury's face when told he could join The Avengers. "I don't save the world, I punish it" was all he said, and was never seen again. Most people considered that a successful meeting since nobody died.

Elektra as killed at "Herofall" one of the non-controlled who died valiantly in the line of duty. Her name was just one of many that lined the monument built at the old Avengers manor, which was now turned into a museum dedicated to teach young and old about the lives and sacrifices of some many who died that day.

And then there was Deadpool. Let's just say he didn't make the cut. He may have been a Great Lakes Avengers, but the man was certifiably crazy. Violent, deranged and a loose cannon, the world didn't need a hero like him. The Avengers didn't need a hero like him. However, he seemed to refuse to take no for an answer and moved into the Helicarrier anyways, declared himself the leader of the Avengers, and tried to change the name of the team to "Deadpool And His Ass-Kicking Awesome Friends TM". Yes, he would even say the world "Trademark", every single time he said the name.

They even tried to make sure that he would never find his way onto the few missions that they ever actually went on, but somehow he always found a way to show up, making complicated situations a thousand times worse. Eventually they just gave up and let him stay, even if they told him twenty times a day he wasn't an Avenger, and to get the hell off the Helicarrier.

The lights suddenly clicked on in the mess hall, and within miliseconds, Natalia had dropped her food, assumed a battle position, and had her guns pointed at the person who just entered.

"So a little birdy told me the good news Natalia, or should I call you Mommy?"

The voice belonged to one Carol Danvers, AKA Ms. Marvel, currently known now as Captain Marvel. She stood at the mess hall entrance in her bathrobe, holding a coffee cup in her crossed arms.

Natalia let her guard down, returning her attention away from her friend and fellow Avengers back to her soggy Orange Juice/Pizza combo.

"I don't know what you're talking about Carol" Natalia said, finishing her third slice of pizza, and washing it down with the orange juice.

"Don't bullshit me Natalia. Fury told me direct. Said he was taking you off the active roster list" Carol said. "So how are you feeling?"
"Tired, hungry, nauseous, scared, excited, anxious. Take your pick" Natalia confided to her friend.
"I think you're going to be a great mother." Carol said, obviously lying.
"You're a horrible liar Carol" Natalia said raising an eyebrow.
"Yeah, I know. But what else am I supposed to say?" Carol said walking over to the coffee machine, pouring herself a cup.

"You haven't told anyone else have you?" Natalia asked.
"No. Fury told me, and I kept it to myself. It's your decision if you want to tell anyone else, although, I think they'll be able to figure it out on a few days" Carol said, taking a huge sip from her cup.

A few days the words echoing through Natalia's head. Amongst everything that had happened in the past few hours, she still hadn't let it sink in. She had days, not months to prepare for what was coming. Late night feedings, diaper changes, first steps, first words, parenting, motherhood.

She felt faint.

"Look, if you ever need any help, you got Sue and Jessica on speed-dial." Carol said, trying to be a good friend.
"I know but still. I'm not quite sure I'm ready for this" Natalia said, her hand finding it's way to her flat stomach.
"I don't think anyone's ever ready for life-changing as that" Carol said, drinking deep her coffee.

"So what do you think?" Natalia asked.
"It doesn't matter what I think. I'm the leader of team of what remains of able bodied superheroes who mostly just sit around all day doing nothing, except for the occasional PR event, or secret mission." Carol said with a dry tone.

Carol had become the leader of the Avengers after Captain America's and Hawkeye's death, Iron Man's coma, and Thor's disappearance. Natalia didn't want the job, instead passing on her recommendation as Carol for team leader onto Fury himself. She still believes she made the right decision.

"On the other hand, I think you're going to need some looser clothes, a skin-tight black leather catsuit dosen't make the best maternity clothes" Carol said with a smart-ass tone.

Natalia let out a laugh.

"God, I'm going to get huge aren't I?" Natalia says, looking at her flat-stomach.
"I wonder if the Helicarrier is large enough to dock a blimp" Carol says with a catty tone.
"Laugh it up Carol, I'll make sure Banner doses you next" Natalia says.
"He tires that I'll take his other arm" Carol says drinking her coffee.

Just then..
1151111111.title: Black Widow (FP Day 1) - A Day In The Life

choices: She decided on a little alone time.
11511111111.content:
Black Widow's communicator went off as she sat there talking to her friend and scarfing down the rest of Flash's pizza.
"This better be good" Natalia thought to herself as she activated her wrist communicator.
"Widow." She said, as Dr. Bruce Banner's face appeared on the tiny screen.
"Natalia it's Banner. How are you doing this morning?" Banner asked, adjusting his glasses with his one good arm
"Well, I just practically ate an entire pizza by myself and I'm still starving" She said, with mild annoyance in her voice.
"Not surprising. The rapid growth of your unborn child is causing a massive need for caloric intake. However, i'd advise against against pigging out on junk food as so many pregnant women are want to do. I'm going to create a menu for you for the new few days that's both delicious and healthy." Banner said.
"So now binge eating on Ice Cream and Cheeseburgers?" Natalia asks with a smirk on her face.
"The menu only there for your benefit. Feel free to do whatever you want, but just know that after the baby is born, the weight is yours to lose" Banner said in an unusually catty tone.

"So what do I owe the pleasure of your call?" Natalia asked.
"I want you to come back down to the medical for a few more tests" Banner states.
"I thought you said everything checked out fine earlier" Natalia said.
"Yes. But that was a few hours ago. I want to run multiple tests daily to make sure everything is progressing well. This is untested medical science here Natalia. You want to make sure everything is okay with your child don't you?" Banner said.
Natalia could see that Banner was appealing to her quickly awakening motherly instincts, and damn it, and it was working.
"Fine." Natalia said.
"Meet me in the medbay in an hour" Banner said plainly, and then his face was gone off her communicator.

"That seem odd to you?" Natalia asked, her years of spying and information gathering telling her that something was off.
"A one-armed scientist who turns into a giant green rage monster you used a super science serum to impregnate one of the world's greatest female secret agents wants to see you and you ask if something is odd?" Carol asked raising an eyebrow.
"Odder than usual." Natalia corrected.
"Banner has always been an odd one, but then again most geniuses are. I'm sure he's just concerned about your health. I mean, this project is his baby, pun not intended" Carol said.
"You're right" Natalia said, her hand resting on the flat of her stomach.

She waited around for an hour, finishing her impromptu meal, and leaving a note for Flash, telling him that was "sorry about the pizza, but it was an emergency. Ask Banner or Fury about it."
She then walked down the hall to the medical bay, and entered, Banner sitting there with a smile on his face.
"Please take a seat. This will only take a little while" He said, pointing to a chair.
Black Widow sat down. She was met with the familiar pinch of the needle entering her arm, as Banner drew the blood.
"So how are we feeling?" Banner asked.
"You've already asked me that" Black Widow answered
"I know. I just want to make sure that you're fine. Your body is going to be going through quite a lot of change over the next few days. I want to make sure you're healthy mentally as well as physically" Banner said, finishing up drawing the blood.

He removed the vial, and loaded it into a machine which fed the data into the computer. He typed a few keys on the keyboard and her bloodwork appeared
on the screen.
"Excellent. More than excellent." He said looking over the data.
"Finding something interesting Doctor Banner?" Natalia asked looking at the data. She may be smart, but everything on the screen looked like Greek to her as the saying goes.
"Hmm? Oh yes. Everything looks great for the most part. Some of your levels are a little high, but it looks like they'll stabilize as your pregnancy progresses over the next few days. I want you to exercise when you get the chance but don't over do it. Also, I would recommend checking up with me daily, at least more than twice. I also have a dietary menu made up for you, some healthy tasty diet options perfect your rapidly growing unborn child. Now granted, this diet isn't Doctor's orders, but more of a guideline. If you want to pig out on junk food, the weight loss after the birth will be your problem" Banner said.

"Can I go now?" Natalia asked, sounding slightly annoyed.
"Yes." Banner said turning back to his computer screen looking at the blood work.
Black Widow sighed and left the medical bay.

- - - - - - -
Back In The Medbay
- - - - - - -

Banner looked at the screen , decoding the information. Tapping a note on his phone, he began to record an audio log.
"Notes on the project, Dr. Bruce Banner reporting. The project is moving ahead faster than I could ever hope. My suggestion to use Natalia "Black Widow" Romanova as a test subject has proven to be the correct choice. Her body is strong enough to deal with the rapid changes being brought about by the serum. Blood work appears normal except for a few high levels that I believe will correct themselves in a few days.

Subject is reporting increased hunger as was expected to deal with rapid gestation. Moving forward with new revision of formula to begin Phase 2 testing. I will use my own genetic sequence as the catalyst. Once introduced into the female subject's blood stream, it should bond with her DNA to replicate the same effect as Subject 1. This should allow her to produce a child with the same gamma-based abilities as myself, minus the actual genetic birth defects that would occur if I was to produce a child with a woman naturally.

I believe in theory this should allow a perfect mixture of the Phase 1 Serum and the Phase 2 serum to create the perfect gamma-powered super hero super solider and the next evolution of humanity. These notes must be kept secret from Fury who has forbidden me from using my "Hulk" as they call it DNA for any kind of this test. Beginning immediate work on Phase 2 and Phase 3 serums".

---------------
Black Widow
---------------

As she walked down the hall, Black Widow thought about the life in front of her, and more importantly, the life inside of her.
Was she going to be mother material? Would she tell her child the truth behind it's origins if he or she asked?

As she thought....

The Benatar sputtered through space, its wings battered and the body highly-damaged. The Guardians of the Galaxy had just pulled off a rescue mission for the Nova Corps, but not before they were attacked by raiders. They pulled it off, just barely. Pulling it off, just barely was basically the way they operated.

Though their ship was nearly destroyed, Peter Quill, or Star-Lord as he liked to refer himself as, didn't seem phased. He blasted music through the ship's speaker system. The rest of the Guardians, weren't exactly amused. They all sat in the cockpit, looking on as Peter sang.

"Touch if you will, my stomach. Feel how it trembles inside. You've go the butterflies all tied up, don't make me chase you. Even doves have pride!" he belted out.

Quill turned around, watching the rest of the group look at him with wide eyes. "Come on, now. Feel free to join in! Gamora, let's hear those pipes!"

"No, Quill," Gamora said, shaking her head.

"Mantis?" he asked.

"I do know know how to sing, Peter," she replied meekly.

"Oh, come on, guys! I can't believe none of you know Prince! I thought he would have been known galaxy-wide!" Quill exclaimed.

"I'm not familiar with this Prince. What province does he rule over?" Drax asked.

Peter sighed. "No he's not...he's not a real prince. Whatever, where are we going again?"

"Christ, Quill! I just told you five minutes ago! I've got a connection in Knowhere that can get this baby fixed as quickly as possible. She'll be good as new in the morning. And if we're lucky, he might hook us up with another job. It's like they don't got ears or something, Groot," Rocket replied.

Groot, who was now closer to a child in size rather than a baby, nodded. "I am Groot."

The ship arrived at Knowhere, the Celestial head turned outpost, and docked close to where Rocket's ally was. Rocket went out to catch up with his contact, and Groot followed suit. Drax took Mantis with him, showing her around and trying to impress her with stories. That left only Gamora and Quill.

He stopped her as she exited the ship. "Where are you headed?"

Gamora turned around, rolling her eyes. "I was going to hit the bar and drink a little. Maybe get into a fight if I'm lucky."

"Mind if I join you?" Peter asked.

She stopped for a moment, pondering the request. "Sure, why not?"

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Peter and Gamora sat at the bar, taking in the sights and sounds of Knowhere as they drank. She looked at him. He seemed more...introspective than usual.

"What's eating you, Peter?" she asked.

"What do you mean? Nothing's eating me! I am one hundred percent not eaten," he replied.

"Come on. I've never seen you not happy while you were drinking," Gamora stated.

Quill sighed. "It's just... I've come to realize that I've had less than ideal father figures throughout my life. The man who I grew up with was a murdering, thieving, bandit, and my actual father was a Celestial who murdered my mom and wanted to wipe out the entire universe. So, you know, both not great."

Gamora nodded. "Yeah. Thanos killed half of my people, raised me as his own, had me and Nebula fight each other to near-death almost every day, and wants to wipe out half of the universe. I guess we have something in common."

They clinked their glasses together and took another sip.

"Tell me something, Gamora," Peter began.

"What do you want me to tell you?" she asked.

"Why aren't we together? I thought that after everything's that happened, especially on Ego's planet, that you liked me. Thanks to Mantis, you already know how I feel about you," he said.

"I...I don't want to get attached. Okay? Doing that before has never worked out well for me. And I think that sooner or later, Thanos will come. And when he does, that might be the end. Of you, and me, and everything. And I don't want to...to have that feeling of what it'd be like if I lost someone close," Gamora explained.

Peter looked at the drinks that lined the walls of the bar. His eyes lit up when he saw one in particular. He got the bartender's attention and signaled for two glasses. The bartender filled it up with the alcohol and slid it towards Quill.

"What's that?" Gamora asked.

"Some liquor from back on Earth. Didn't know they had this stuff here. Way stronger than most of the stuff you'll find on Knowhere," he said.

Gamora scoffed. "No way."

Peter raised an eyebrow. "You doubt it? How about you find out? Shot for shot with me. Right now."

Gamora looked up at him.
11531211.title: Something cosmic

choices: She runs into everyone else in the mess room (RESERVED)
She gets back to her room fine
115312111.content:
”You're on, Starlord” Gamora replied, smirking.

Quill signalled the bartender to bring the drink over and grabbed two shot glasses. He placed one in front of each of them a filled them up with whatever the liquor was.

”You're about to go down Gamora, ” Quill said, ready to start.

”We’ll see about that” Gamora poked back at him.

They raised their glasses to the other and downed it. It tasted bitter and very strong, but not strong enough for Gamora to lose. She looked to Quill, who seemed to have shrugged it off just as quick, if not quicker than her.

The bartender poured another shot. They locked eyes and drank it fast. Another. And another. Soon enough, four shots had blurred into several, but neither opponent had given in yet.

”Three... T-two. One go!” Quill managed to say, slurring his words.

”I-I can't. You... Youu win” Gamora struggled to say.

”Woo! Haha! I, I am the b-best!” Quill responded, celebrating with another shot.

”N-no no Peter, no, no more drink,” Gamora said, trying to stop Peter from overdrinking.

”Why?! I-I won?” he exclaimed, a little annoyed that someone was stopping his fun. ”Is it be-because you Love mee?”

”Wh-what if it, if it was?” Gamora said, unable to control herself.

Quill leaned over to her and kissed her. It would have been more romantic had neither of them been drunk, making it a very sloppy kiss. But it was a kiss nonetheless. And Gamora returned the favour, kissing him back as well. They stopped for a second and locked eyes.

”The ship?” they both asked simultaneously.

They got up and ran drunkenly to the ship, stopping for a bout of random giggling or vomiting every now and again. Eventually, the Benatar came into view and the two figures stumbled up the ramp, undressing as they went. They kissed passionately, stopping to kiss before reaching Peters bedroom. Gamora pushed him down onto the bed, ready to go.

---------

Gamora woke up with a thumping headache pounding in her head. She tried opening her eyes but the lights were too bright for her, so they remained closed. She rolled onto her side groggily, bumping into something. Annoyed she tried to push it away before it grunted back at her.

”Stop it, I'm awake!” she heard Peter groan.

If she was in bed with Peter and had been near blackout drunk the night before, then that meant- her train of thought was cut off by the overwhelming urge to vomit. She rushed out of bed into the bathroom and started chundering into the toilet.

”Lightweight...” Peter mumbled.

She would have responded, but another wave of vomiting forced her down again. She had never felt the need to vomit this much. Maybe she was just a lightweight.

”Peter, what happened last night?” she asked, her voice croaking.

”Put two and two together” He grunted, still half asleep.

Gamora blushed with embarrassment. Sure she had wanted this, and still did, but doing it drunk? That was less than ideal. ”Peter no one hears of this, Ok?”

He grumbled something unintelligible in response.

”Peter please!” she said, before vomiting again.

”Yes ok! Fine” he said.

Gamora sighed, feeling awful. She stood up and started to leave, trying to avoid the others.
115312111.title: She accepts the challenge (RESERVED)

1153121111.content:
Gamora wasn't successful in her attempt to make it back to her room without being noticed. She carefully tiptoed through the ship, making it to the mess hall, until--

"Good morning, Gamora! Did you and Peter have fun last night?" Mantis asked.

She, Rocket, and Groot sat in the mess hall eating breakfast. Gamora tried to cover up her underwear-clad body, then spotted her clothes lying in a pile on the floor. She leaped forward and grabbed them, quickly putting them on.

"What are you talking about? Quill just...had to show me something in his room, that's all!" Gamora exclaimed.

Rocket nodded. "Oh, I'm sure he showed ya somethin', alright!"

"I am Groot?"

"No, don't worry about it, Groot. Nothing that you need to be knowing about right now," Rocket replied.

"We didn't do anything!" Gamora said.

Rocket nodded. "Sure! I believe you, don't worry."

Gamora sighed. "Okay, good."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Gamora walked down one of the ship's hallways, towards her room. That was, until Drax exited his room right in front of her.

"Ah, Gamora! How was your lovemaking with Quill?" he asked.

She sighed and continued walking to her room.

"Not well, I take it," Drax said, joining the others in the mess hall.

As soon as she entered her room, Gamora bolted to her bathroom and vomited again. She'd never gotten this sick from drinking before. Was Quill right? Was that really the strongest stuff available?

Gamora tried to shake it off and slipped into some different clothes. Her stomach rumbled. She rubbed her hand over the flat, toned surface. If she were this hungover, some food might do her good.

She returned to the mess hall, and saw that Quill had joined them. He looked up and his eyes widened.

"Hi...Gamora..." he trailed off, having trouble finding the right words.

"Hi," she replied.

Gamora headed to the kitchen and grabbed some food packets, more than she usually did. The rest of the crew looked at her as she gobbled down the food.

"What are you looking at?" Gamora asked.

The rest of them looked away.

"So last night, you know how I was talking about my contact hooking us up with another job?" Rocket asked.

Quill, Mantis, Groot, and Drax nodded. Gamora was too focused on her food.

Rocket gave her the side eye and continued his speech.

"Well, we've got it, and it's a big one! We'll be so rich we won't know what to do with ourselves."

"So what's the catch? It's gotta be pretty complex if it's so lucrative," Peter noted.

"It is indeed, but nothing we can't handle. There's a vault on Xandar that has a gun, along with some other artifacts that we can steal if we have time. This gun can unlock any door that you aim it at. That'll be useful, since we have to break into Kyln. There's a prisoner there that we have to break out, and after that we gotta take them to Contraxia. There's a contact on Contraxia that'll give us info, but only in exchange for the prisoner. They'll give us the location of a convoy carrying all sorts of valuable items. Weapons, riches, the works!"

The Guardians looked at each other.

"Rocket is right, it is a complex plan," Mantis said.

"We're the Guardians of the Galaxy, ain't we? Come on, what's the worst that could happen?" Rocket asked.

"Do we actually have a choice?" Gamora wondered.

"Not exactly. If you don't want to do it, then I'll just kick you off my ship!" he exclaimed.

Peter stood up and put his hand on Rocket's shoulder. "It's my ship, but I agree with Rocket. This sounds like it could be worth it. I'm in!"

The rest of the crew agreed, and the plan was set into motion.
1153121111.title: She runs into everyone else in the mess room

11531211111.content:
After fleshing out the plan after breakfast, the rest of the day went pretty smoothly. Gamora’s nausea began to subside as the day wore on, and most of the day was spent in the bridge, on the way to Xandar. Everyone else was mostly quiet, save for Peter singing along to his music, and the occasional snore from drax. Groot was back and forth from his seat, to everyone elses, his curious nature drawing him towards everything.

Before long, the day was ending, and most of the crew were heading to sleep, leaving Peter and Gamora in the cockpit, Groot curled asleep on Gamora’s lap. Despite what had happened last night, things between the two of they were fine. There had been a few awkward silences between them or the occasional irritating comment from one of the others, mostly Rocket and Drax.

Gamora carefully lifted roof out of her lap and held him up, resting his head on her shoulder. ”I'm going to take Groot to bed, and then head to sleep myself, ” She said quietly to Peter.

”Night then” was Peters reply.

Gamora leant down to him and planted a kiss on his cheek. ”Good night,” she said, smirking as she walked away, Leaving Peter speechless

She lay Groot down on his bed and turned off the lights. He looked at cute, just curled up on his bed. Gamora smiled at him and left for her own room. She turned and shut the door, and got undressed and ready to sleep, but felt a wave I nausea come over her and rushed to the bathroom. Just as I thought it was gone she thought to herself. When it was over she lay on her bed and closed her eyes, drifting off to sleep.

----------

Gamora woke up. She had grown accustomed to waking up early and quickly from her experiences with Thanos. But now she chose to lay in bed for a while longer. She sat up slightly, nothing some irritation around her breasts. They felt sore, and she felt them try and alleviate some of the soreness, but she could feel vomit building in her throat and stopped, running for the bathroom. She stayed in the bathroom for a while, higher over the toilet preparing for more vomit.

Eventually, she was confident enough that she wouldn't vomit and left for the mess area. Luckily for her, it appeared that no one else was up yet, and she grabbed several packets of food and made her way back to her room, getting started on a packet on her way. Why am I so hungry all of a sudden, a minute ago I was vomiting my guts out she thought she retreated into her bedroom with her pile of food.

”Good morning!” a cheery voice said, making Gamora freeze where she was stood.

”Good morning, Mantis, ” Gamora replied through mouthfuls, trying to hide her stash of food.

”Are you feeling okay today?” Mantis asked curiously.

”What? Oh, yeah I'm okay today, just a little bit of sick, ” Gamora said, not wanting to talk for much longer.

”Oh that is very go-” Mantis was interrupted by the sound of Gamora’s door shutting and the faint sound of vomiting.

Gamora was once again hunched over the toilet, trying to hold her hair up, and vomiting into the bowl. Something was seriously wrong.

”One minute I'm starving and the next I need to vomit, what is happening?” she asked herself, exasperated.

----------

A few days had passed and Gamora was beginning to recover. The nausea was starting to go away, only coming back every now and again, but her craving for food had not yet subsided, and if anything it had grown.

She was stood in her room getting dressed for the day and inspected herself in the mirror. She looked over her toned green skin, and the muscles beneath, before looking to her normally toned abdomen. Recently she had started feeling bloated, and she was. It wasn't noticeable by any means, but she could definitely tell that she was bigger than normal.

Talking about bigger than normal, her breasts had started to get sorer and had grown a size up in the past few days. She cupped them, feeling how tender they had gotten, and grabbed a bra. As she was slipping the bra on, out of the corner of her eye she saw Groot wander into the room, with a slightly lost look on his face. Gamora dropped her bra and rushed to cover her breasts.

”Groot, what are you doing in here?” She asked him, crouching down, to his face.

”I am Groot?” he replied, sounding guilty.

Gamora sighed. ”Don't worry, you're not in trouble, but someone is, ” She said to Groot. ”ROCKET! Don't let Groot wander on his own!” she yelled, continuing to get dressed.
11531211111.title: Another day

115312111111.content:
Gamora put on her bra and threw a shirt on as she heard Rocket walk down the hallway towards her room.

"Alright, sure! But there's these things called locks, they help keep your door shut when you don't want people to wander in. You should try it!" Rocket yelled.

As soon as Rocket entered the doorway, Gamora angrily threw a food packet at him. It smashed against the wall, crumbling to little pieces of dust. Rocket immediately backtracked and exited the room.

"Okay, good talk. See ya, Gamora."

Gamora walked over to the crushed food packet. The food was smashed, but still edible. She opened the package and dumped the crumbs into her mouth.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

That night, the guardians sat around the table in the mess hall of the Benatar, eating dinner. They had finally arrived at Xandar, and while Rocket cased the arms dealer that housed the vault containing the gun, Drax and Quill went out to get food. They were going to wait a few days before striking, making sure that they were fully prepared.

They each were digging into a carton of food. Except for Gamora, who was already on a second carton. Drax watched on as Gamora ate and laughed.

"Ha! Keep eating like that and you'll get fat! And we'll see who will be the strongest warrior after that!" he bellowed.

"Shut it, Drax! I'm not fat!" she replied, stuffing more food in her face.

This exchange was mostly ignored by the rest of the group. Peter looked over his food, a confused look growing on his face. He looked at Gamora's carton that she was currently finishing off.

"Hey, I thought we were gonna split that one?" he asked.

Gamora looked down at her carton that was now empty.

"Oh. Yeah. Sorry."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Two days later, Gamora stood in her room, looking at her reflection in the mirror as she got dressed. Luckily for her, the nausea had completely subsided, but the constant hunger persisted. She assumed that it was due to how sick she was throughout the past week, that it was her body's way of catching up.

She was still bloated too. It wasn't anything that the others would see, but she definitely did. Frustrated, Gamora pressed a hand into the puffy mass that pushed out just a couple of inches. It felt firm. Hopefully this was just bloat, and not her starting to gain weight.

Gamora put on her clothes and headed to the bridge, were the other guardians waited. Rocket had up a projection of the map of the place.

"So here's the plan. As you can see, the vault is located in the center of the complex. Leave that to me and Groot. I'll sweet talk the dealer, and he should give me a tour. Once we see the vault, I'll break in while Groot keeps me protected. Now, outside there's a large air vent that leads to where you three are going to get into once you shut down the fans," he began, pointing to Gamora, Drax, and Quill.

"Oh! What will I do?" Mantis asked.

"You, Mantis, will keep watch on the ship. A thankless and valuable job, I might add," Rocked said.

Mantis nodded excitedly. "Okay! I will do that to the best of my abilities!"

Rocked raised an eyebrow. "Right. Now, back to the plan. Once you're in, you'll be close to a guard outpost. What you three are gonna do is beat the everliving crap outta them. Draw some heat off of me as I try to break in. Once you're done there, go left down the hallway and eventually you'll hit the security center. Take out whoever is in there, and help disable some of the vault's shields and control the cameras to let me know how much time I have once I'm inside the vault. I know we're there for the gun, but I wanna take as much as I can outta there."

Each of the members comprehended the plan.

"Alright. Ready?" Rocket asked.
115312111111.title: Continue (RESERVED)

choices: They don't get back to the ship
1153121111111.content:
Before they left, they took a couple of minutes to finish up, grab extra weapons or ammo. Gamora was in her room, staring at herself in the mirror, inspecting her bloated belly. She grabbed a packet of food and started eating, inspecting her side profile in the mirror. It's not enough to throw off my balance, I'll be fine she thought to herself.

She heard knocks at her door. ”Gamora, we're going now” she heard Peter say from behind the door.

”Be right out” she called back, pulling her shirt down and finishing her food.

She stepped out to join the others and walked with them out of the ship. She looked back and saw mantis waving to them enthusiastically, and smiled back to her. The group walked towards the facility, conscious of looking suspicious if they were running. They had planned the heist for the evening so that they had some darkness to act as cover, but have the minimum number of guards active.

Rocket and Groot broke off from the others and headed towards the gate, while Drax, Peter, and Gamora headed towards the vent. They arrived at the vent only to find that it wasn't unguarded like they'd expected, and they quickly dived for cover.

”What do we do?” Quill asked.

”I shall take them. They will never see me coming” Drax answered, Starting to get up.

”No, but they'll hear you coming if you do your war cry,” Gamora said, anticipating Drax’s actions.

”But I need to do it. It gets me pumped!” Drax retorted.

”It also gets Rocket and Groot killed!” she hissed back.

”I got ’em, ” Quill called to them, the barrels of his guns smoking, and the two guards unconscious on the floor.

Gamora and Drax both looked surprised, but carried on. They lifted the grate and climbed into the vent, hiding the guard's bodies inside. They strode warily through the darkened tunnel, heading towards the guard post.

”Left or right?” Drax asked.

”Left! Did you not listen to rocket? He said left like 50 times!” Quill replied, already exasperated with Drax.

”I did listen to him! I know that we have to fight some people!” Drax quipped back.

Gamora and Peter looked at each other with a shared look of idiot. They pushed onwards and came to the end of the vent. Gamora peeked outside and saw the guard post, filled with guards coming and going from other parts of the vault. She looked to Drax and Peter.

”Whats the plan now. There's a lot of guards?” she asked the two of them.

“There are a lot, aren’t there. If we sneak down and-” Peter said, getting cut off by Drax bursting through the grate into the guard post.

There was no point in trying to be sneaky now, and the two of them jumped out into the fray. Peter covered them from a distance, taking potshots at anyone who got too close, while Drax and Gamora we're both cutting through the guards like butter. Gamora, however, felt slower than usual. She couldn't focus. All she could think about was her bloating, her illness, her hunger. All these thoughts were clouding her head.

She heard Drax laughing, and sighed, annoyed. Annoyed that she couldn't keep up with him, even though she was always ahead if him. Suddenly she felt someone tackle her to the ground, and panicked, thrashing at the guard to get him off of her. She heard two gunshots and saw Peter stood across from her with his guns held up, smoke rising from the barrels.

”Are you okay? That guy got the jump on you pretty easily” He said, helping her up.

”I'm fine. I'm just having a bad day” she replied, deadpan.

”I have won!” Drax yelled from the other side of the room.

Gamora’s mood did not improve. It also didn't help that there were now alarms blaring and footsteps approaching from all directions. The trio braced themselves for a second wave. They fought them off again, Drax mowing through them, Peter picking them off from a distance, and Gamora making her way through them. As they fought through them, gamora noticed a few of them peeling off, heading towards the vault. She tried to stop them, but only caught one of the ones at the back.

”Peter! Drax! Get them!” she yelled, trying to stop them from jeopardising the plan

The two of them tried to get to the group, only managing to stop a few, leaving most of them to get to the vault, where Rocket and Groot were.

”Rocket, you've got guards headed your way! Do we chase ’em or what?” Quill called down the comms line.

”clear the security room, destroy the console, it'll make breaking this door down a whole lot easier” Rocket replied.

”On it!” Quill said, signalling Gamora and Drax to follow him.

They ran to the security room, taking out ant guards on the way. They cleared the room as fast as they could, destroying the consoles in the room with a couple of grenades. As they left the room, Gamora felt out of breath, which was strange because usually age never got out of breath this easily. Something was definitely wrong with her, because this definitely was not just a ’bad day’.

----------

Outside the vault, Rocket was crouched outside the doors next to a small panel. He was busily re-wiring and reshaping the circuitry inside. A sudden surge of energy, followed by the loud groan of the doors opening told him that the others had destroyed the security room, which meant that the plan was going to shit.

”Groot, come on we don't got a lot of time!” he called to Groot, who was sat on the floor, bored.

”I am Groot!” he replied excitedly.

Rocket ran through the vault, trying to find the gun. Outside the door, he could hear the echoes of footsteps, getting louder and louder. He ran past piles of credits, weapons and other expensive looking things, pissed off that he couldn't grab them. He found the gun that he was looking for and climbed up into one of the vents, with Groot following close behind. He made it onto the roof and saw the others running back to the ship.

”boy am I gonna have words with ’em” he growled under his breath.
1153121111111.title: They're ready (RESERVED)

11531211111111.content:
Gamora, Peter, and Drax made it back on the Benatar before Rocket and Groot, and they were able to collect their bearings before the two arrived. They each caught their breath, Gamora especially, as she sucked in the cool air of the ship. Mantis watched on, a confused look on her face.

Moments later, Groot scrambled onto the ship. His eyes were wide.

"Groot! Are you alright? Where's Rocket?" Gamora asked.

"I am Groot..." he replied, a sad tone in his voice.

"Oh, wait. Only Rocket can understand what he's saying," she said.

"That was pointless," Drax added.

Quill stepped up and put a hand on Groot's shoulder. "Hang on, hang on! I've been paying attention to their conversations. I think I've got a pretty good idea of what he's saying. Come on, bud. What happened?

"I am Groot..."

Peter stepped back, horrified. "Oh my god! He didn't make it?"

Groot raised an eyebrow. "I am Groot?"

"That's terrible. I'm sorry you had to see that, little guy!"

Groot just shook his head.

"Okay, it's obvious that Peter's translating skills are not very good. Let's just wait and see if Rocket shows," Gamora suggested.

As if on cue, there was the sound of patters ambling up the ramp. It was Rocket, soaking wet. His fur dripped water onto the ship's floor.

"You. Jerk!" Rocket yelled.

"Who is the jerk?" Drax asked.

"All of yas! Except for Mantis, I guess. First, let's start with the distraction team, shall we? How the hell did you let that many guards slip by? There were so many riches in that vault! Second, thank you Groot for abandoning me on the roof! I had to jump from there to the fountain in order to dodge all the bullets flyin' at me. Groot's just a kid, so I can forgive that. But you three? Oh, boy, if you think I'm gonna hold back from tearing' you a new one..."

"It was Gamora's fault!" Drax exclaimed.

Gamora gritted her teeth. "Me? You were the one who rushed ahead before we could set up a plan!"

"And you let the guards slip by, giving Rocket less time!" he fired back.

Gamora sighed and looked at Quill. "Peter, back me up here!"

"I mean...you did say you were having a bad day when that guard took you by surprise, but I think we all--" Quill started, before being interrupted by Rocket.

"Oh, so it was her fault, huh? I shoulda known..."

Peter stepped between Rocket and Gamora as he approached her. "Wait a minute, Rocket. Drax did jump the gun early, and I missed some shots too. We all screwed up."

Rocket waved him off. "Nah, nah. I know you gotta stick up for her, but she's the one that's taking the blame for this. If she didn't let them get past her, we woulda been walking out rich!"

"I am not taking the blame for this! We all could have done better, so the brunt of the failure shouldn't just fall on one person!" Gamora said.

"You know, if Quill was right, and you're off your game, then maybe it would be best if you sat out the next phase of this job. The prison break's the most dangerous part, anyways," Rocket said.

Gamora scoffed. "Is that so? Well, maybe I will!"

She stormed off and headed to her room, the slamming of her door heard from the mess hall.

"She's been very angry lately," Mantis noted with a frown.

Inside her room, Gamora threw herself on the bed and stared at the ceiling. A few seconds later, there was a knock at the door.

"If that's Rocket, I'm going to kill you," she promised.

"No, it's...it's me," Peter said on the other side of the door.

"Fine," Gamora huffed.

Peter opened the door and stood in the doorway.

"I'm sorry that that just happened. But you know how Rocket is. Always has to put the blame on someone. He...he has a point, you know. You do seem off. Maybe taking some time off will do you some good," he suggested.

"Yeah. Maybe you're right. Peter?" she asked as he was about to head back out.

"What's up?" he asked.

"Thanks for checking up on me," Gamora said.

Quill smiled and nodded, then returned to the mess hall. Gamora sat in bed a little while longer, her hands eventually finding her bloated middle.

Hopefully you'll go away soon... she thought.
11531211111111.title: Back on the ship (END OF WEEK 1)

115312111111111.content:
Gamora sat in her room, tired. She yawned and started getting ready to go to sleep. Normally she would have been up later, talking to the others, but she was in no mood for talking now, and she was far more tired than normal. She lay on her bed, curled beneath her blanket with a hand on her bloated belly, feeling the taut skin.

----------

Gamora woke up to the sound of her door being slowly opened, and someone walking in. The heavy footsteps told her that, thankfully, wasn't Rocket. It couldn't be Groot either, and Drax had no compulsion to come into her room, neither did Mantis for that matter. So that left-

”Hey, just wanted to say goodbye before we left, ” she heard Peter say quietly.

She rolled onto her side to face him, opening her eyes to look at him. ”bye bye” she mumbled groggily.

He leant his hand on her and kissed her forehead, putting a small smile on her face. He felt the area where his hand rested, noting that it felt bloated and stuck out on her.

”Either you ate something real bad, or you have a pillow on you,” he said, slightly confused.

”Is a pillow, ” Gamora groaned, too tired to think properly.

Peter left after leaving another kiss on her forehead and closed her door quietly, leaving her alone once more. After a few minutes, she sat up slowly, revealing her rounding stomach. It stuck out further now, still only noticeable with concentration, but still there all the same. She massaged it as she remembered how close Peter had just come to finding it, thanking herself for lying.

”Right. I need to get rid of this” she said to herself, running her stomach. ”time for a diet, ”

Her stomach had other ideas, and let out a low rumble, telling her to eat. She groaned in frustration as she stepped out of bed and put on a loose t-shirt to cover herself with. She walked out of her room to the mess, where she grabbed a few food packets and a drink for her breakfast. As she ate, she noticed Mantis wander in, looking for something to eat.

”Good morning Gamora! How did you sleep?” she asked, sounding annoyingly cheery.

”Fine.” Replied Gamora, not in the mood to talk.

”Oh, that is good. How are you feeling?” Mantis asked, trying to make small talk.

”Fine” Gamora said again, getting slightly more pissed off now. ”could you just, go, please?”

Mantis looked kind of sad after that and left the room, dragging her feet along the floor. Gamora realised that she had come off as bitchy, but by now it was a little late to change that.

She left for her bedroom after breakfast, taking a couple of swings from her drink as she walked. She decided that she would try and work out, to try and burn off her belly, and maintain a good shape. She started with some sit-ups, lying back with her knees up. She tried one, but her belly stopped we from bending over properly. She tried a few more but gave up and went to do some crunches, but found herself facing the same problem.

She grunted in resignation and sat back against her bed, resting her hands on her belly. She poked the tight skin, and to her surprise, she felt something move back. She tried it again, getting the same result, a sort of squirming feeling from her belly. Must just be gas she thought.
115312111111111.title: Week 2 begins (RESERVED)

1153121111111111.content:
Gamora thought to stop by Mantis' room after working out, but ultimately decided against it. She probably didn't want to talk after the way Gamora shut her down earlier. Perhaps it'd be better if she let some time pass. For the next few hours, Gamora primarily switched between eating and trying to do whatever workout that she was able to do. The eating took up much more of her day than working out did.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

A few hours later, Gamora found herself in a similar situation that she was in earlier in the day. Her stomach was rumbling constantly. She wanted to fight it off. After all, she'd eaten enough for today. But she couldn't. She was starving.

Gamora made her way to the mess hall and dug in, repeating the situation from this morning. As she dug in, she saw Mantis enter the room out of the corner of her eye. Once Mantis saw that Gamora was there, she immediately stared at the floor and turned around to leave.

Guilt smacked Gamora in the face, and she spoke up before Mantis could leave. "Mantis, come back!"

She stopped in her tracks and turned back around, still refusing to look up.

"I want to apologize for the way I treated you earlier. I wasn't in a good mood, but I still shouldn't have done what I did. Why don't you sit over here if you're gonna eat?" Gamora offered.

Mantis slowly walked towards her, grabbed a food packet, and sat down across from Gamora. She slowly ate her meal. Finally, she looked up at Gamora.

"So you are feeling better?" she asked.

Gamora nodded, then shrugged her shoulders. "I'm not nauseous anymore. But...I still feel a little weird."

"Well, it's good that you're a little better!" Mantis smiled.

"Yeah. I just realized that this is the first time that we're going to really get to know each other," Gamora noted.

Mantis giggled. "It is!"

Gamora couldn't help but laugh too. Her childlike innocence was impossible to ignore.

"So you were raised by Ego? What was that like?" she wondered.

Mantis fidgeted in her chair. "At first I thought that it was a good thing. That it was normal. Then I met you all, and I knew that this was how a family was supposed to be."

Gamora smiled. "Oh, I don't think this is anything like how a family should be. But I guess I was in the same boat as you growing up."

"Do you ever think of being a parent?" Mantis asked, seemingly out of the blue.

"What? Why? I...I honestly haven't really thought about it. Growing up Thanos only cared that Nebula and I were the best warriors possible. Anything else wasn't really brought up. It's honestly never really crossed my mind," she admitted.

Gamora yawned as she finished the sentence. "I think I'm gonna head to bed. I'm still reeling from the vault heist."

Mantis nodded, seeming to understand. "Okay. Good night, Gamora."

"Good night," she replied.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Gamora undressed in her bedroom. As she headed to her bed, she caught her reflection in the mirror. Was her stomach bigger than it was in the morning? She stopped and looked at her belly carefully, running a hand over it. It certainly seemed like it was. Not by much, but there was some growth, to be sure.

Gamora could only shake her head as she lay down in bed. She fell asleep slowly, trying to ignore the light squirming from her belly.
1153121111111111.title: Later that day

choices: She gets to the mess area
11531211111111111.content:
Another day had gone by, much the same as the previous. She woke up, inspected herself, went to eat, talked to mantis, tried working out, ate some more, etc. Except for this morning, Gamora stayed in bed a little longer. She was sat with her back to the wall, with her hands on her belly. It had gotten bigger over the past few days, sticking out far more than before. She looked at it in the mirror. It pushed her sort up a little, revealing a sliver of green flesh, and was probably big enough for others to notice now.

She heard her door opening and threw her covers over herself, trying to hide her bloated belly. Mantis walked in, with a little tray covered in food packets.

”I brought you some food so you don't have to get up,” she said, smiling at Gamora.

”Thanks, I guess,” Gamora said, taking the tray from her.

”Did I do something wrong?” Mantis asked with a confused look on her face.

”What? Oh no, it's fine. It's just strange having it brought to me” Gamora replied, not wanting to hurt Mantis’ feelings again.

”It is just because you have been ill and tired, I didn't want you to hurt yourself,” Mantis said, now smiling again. ”See you later!”

Mantis left the room gleefully, leaving Gamora alone with her breakfast. She began eating, finishing off the meal quickly. She turned and sat with her legs off the bed, brushing crumbs off of herself as she stood up. She walked over to the mirror and looked at herself.
